intro: Lithospermum chihuahuanum, commonly known as the Chihuahua rock pepper, is a perennial herb native to the arid regions of North America. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, branched stems and small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. Its leaves are usually opposite and lance-shaped, with a rough texture. The fruit is a capsule that contains numerous tiny, dark seeds, which are dispersed by wind or animals.
